title: (x) Building Letters 3 sans - Botanika {Dan R}
content:
Hi guys:

At first I thought this was Letter Gothic with Slang and then I checked and its not. I can’t think of the font that has this funky E…What ever it is appears not be included with the book… which I will buying anyways

Thanks for helping,

Mikey

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2-3b.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402033849/http:/typophile.com/files/2-3b.jpg) | 73.39 KB |
| [bl3magazine-on\_6312b.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402033849/http:/typophile.com/files/bl3magazine-on_6312b.jpg) | 47.08 KB |
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
I don’t know what the font is, but I think that E is actually a flipped 3.

Nick Cooke
You could contact [Filip Blažek](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402033849/http:/typophile.com/user/1344). He’d be able to tell you.

It is a SuitcaseType face, if I remember properly. Maybe Botanika?  
 [http://suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402033849/http:/suitcasetype.com/page.php?lmut=en)

And I very much doubt that that E is a flipped 3! It is an alternate (and a cool one, at that)

hmmm… Looks like the ‘E’ is unicode 0190- Latin Capital Letter Open E. Which is from the Latin Extended B portion the font.

But is it Botanika???

MIKEY

Yes it is, but just an alt letter- not from some where in unicode outer-space!

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/suitcase/botanika/lite-alt-regular/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402033849/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/suitcase/botanika/lite-alt-regular/)

Thanks guys

Mikey
